title: UMD, My9SN Extend Agreement Through 2018-19
text:
UMD, My9SN Extend Agreement Through 2018-19 
By Zach Schneider UMD, My9SN Extend Agreement Through 2018-19 October 8, 2015 Updated Oct 8, 2015 at 4:48 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- The My 9 Sports Network has been the television home of University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) athletics for the past six years, and the Duluth-based station will continue to carry the Bulldogs for the next three years. 
The new agreement calls for KBJR 6, on the My 9 Sports Network, to televise home UMD men's hockey and football games through the 2018-19 season. 
New in this agreement is expanded coverage of women’s hockey, volleyball, as well as men’s and women’s basketball. A number of men's hockey road games will also be televised as available. 
As part of the long-term agreement, KBJR6 continues to make significant investments in broadcast elements and quality. 
“This season, we are very pleased that families who subscribe to Dish Network can watch our UMD games on My 9," said Dave Jensch, KBJR Vice President and Station Manager. "We are also working on equipment upgrades that will ultimately allow our broadcasts to air in HD.” 
"UMD Athletics is pleased to extend our partnership with KBJR 6 for the next three years," said UMD Athletic Director Josh Berlo. "Moreover, the Bulldog faithful will be able to see more sports and more games in ever improving broadcast quality with an expanding reach through the My9 Sports Network.”
